panels.visual: Wide interior shot of Hind's tent. Incense hangs thick enough to taste. Rahzalahn sits in one corner with her oud. Abu-Rayhan bends over maps. And in the place of command, seated on cushions with the ease of one born to authority, waits Hind herself - jet-black eyes missing nothing.
panels.dialogue: Hind: "Greetings. I am Hind. Who might you be?"

panels.visual: The group stands before Hind, having surrendered their weapons at the entrance. Bansi has dropped considerably more blades than seemed possible for one person. The weapon rack groans under Eskil's massive sword.
panels.narration: Bansi dropped rather more weapons than seemed entirely possible for one person to have been carrying.

panels.visual: Rahzalahn's fingers freeze on the oud strings as she sees Eskil. Her eyes widen with old grief and hatred. The tension is palpable - she recognizes what he is immediately.
panels.dialogue: Rahzalahn: "My lady, he is a Norseman! His people destroyed mine."
